job_description:
• Join our 30,000 everyday heroes.
• A global technology and professional services company that delivers consulting, technology and mission services to every major agency across the U.
• Government, defense and intelligence community.
• Our 30,000 experts extract the power of technology to create immediate value and deliver solutions at the edge of innovation.
• We operate across 30 countries worldwide, offering leading capabilities in digital modernization, AI/ML, Cloud, Cyber and application development.
• Together with our clients, we strive to create a safer, smarter world by harnessing the power of deep expertise and advanced technology.
• For more information about GDIT's Privacy Policy, click here: https://www.
• Com/privacy-policy/notices/.

• This enables us to remember your preferences (for example, your choice of language or region) or when you register on areas of the Sites, such as our web programs or extranets.
• Expertise in the K8s ecosystem, especially as it pertains to large scale inferenceOperational experience with atleast one of sglang, or vllm and with kserve, llm-d.
• Experience running inference as a service can be substituted in-lieu of experience with frameworks such as kserve or llm-d.
• Preferred languages are go and python.
• Experience with modern concurrent programmingEffective communicatior with keen attention to detail.
• Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent AMD Partner Hub Authorized Distributors AMD University Program Prior experience roadmapping deeply technical areas is highly valuable.
• Functionality Cookies Switch Label labelThese cookies are used to recognize you when you return to the Sites.
• These cookies store data such as online identifiers (including IP address and device identifiers) along with the information used to provide the function.

job_title: AI Models MAD - Model Automation and Dashboarding
job_description:
• Software Engineering Excellence: Proficiency in Python and C++ with deep experience in performance tuning, debugging, and robust test design, ensuring reliable, maintainable, high-performance codebases.
• Programming & Tooling: Strong Python development skills, with experience in test automation, CI/CD, and Linux scripting.
• Performance Analysis: Strong experience with profiling tools, system monitoring, or regression tracking systems for deep learning models.
• DevOps & Dashboards: Solid experience in performance dashboards, visualization tools (e.
• Communication & Ownership: Strong written and verbal communication skills with a proactive approach to defining and driving development efforts.
• This enables us to remember your preferences (for example, your choice of language or region) or when you register on areas of the Sites, such as our web programs or extranets.
• Undergraduate and/or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
• Model Testing & Validation: Automate functional and performance testing of AI models across ROCm-supported hardware using scalable tools and pipelines.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
• In this role, you will play a key part in defining software requirements, designing embedded solutions, and verifying system performance, ensuring our maintenance systems meet the evolving needs of modern aircraft.
• The ideal candidate will bring hands‑on experience with system‑level testing, REST APIs, structured data formats, and embedded or IoT platforms to ensure the reliability, performance, and compliance of technologies deployed across mission‑critical environments worldwide.
• You’ll bridge engineering and IT to ensure complex aerospace development ecosystems perform at scale, meet rigorous standards, and align with regulatory and export‑controlled requirements.
• This position is ideal for engineers experienced in modern software development methodologies, debugging, and performance optimization, who thrive in highly technical, cross‑functional environments.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements You will report directly to our Senior Engineering Manager and you will work out of our Phoenix, AZ location on a Hybrid work schedule.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
